Reviews.Title: Loving it for $139
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "lh"
Reviews.Content: So I was in the market for a budget tablet (could not spend $500 on an iPad).  I tried the 7" Kindle Fire (not HD) and a 7" Lenovo Ideatab (which I really liked and found for $149). But I really wanted a bigger tablet.After seeing this get quite a few good reviews for the price, I decided to give it a try.What I was looking for:  a larger tablet that I could Skype with, watch Netflix and Amazon Instant Video on, and generally surf the web and check email.Well, I can Skype with this.  It has a front facing camera.  Not the best quality so I wouldn't ever use this as a camera, but it's good for Skyping.I am actually able to watch Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, and YouTube on this in great quality!  There are times when it is blocky and fuzzy when it is trying to buffer but other than that, it is great for watching movies on and the large screen is wonderful for that.Surfing the web, I am able to use Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox in addition to the stock Android browser.  But I am able to access the Google Play store and use Google Docs.  I can even access the Amazon Appstore for their free apps of the days.I do have to say, for $139, you do have to realize that there will be some performance concerns:1.  It takes a while to charge, especially if you run the battery down.  It doesn't seem to charge if you are using the tablet while plugged in, but the battery has been lasting me 4-5 hours at a time.2.  The only big issue I have really had is that it is intermittently on the slow and steady side in terms of browsing and running apps, mostly when you are multi-tasking.  Every now and then, I get a delay and then it states that a certain app or browser is not responding.  It gives me the option to Wait or Cancel.  Usually if I click on Wait, it then responds right away.  It is a minor irritation, but I am pretty patient and am not at all put off by it, especially considering that I only paid $139 for a 9 inch tablet that on the whole works great!I love it and would definitely get another one if I needed it

Reviews.Title: A Good Talet With a Few Annoyances (RETURNED)
Reviews.Author: Devon Day
Reviews.Content: LAST UPDATE: 3/26/13 - The headphone jack stopped working properly today, so I have returned the item for a refund. I would suggest avoiding this item if possible. If not, then don't expect to use the headphone jack very often. It's good if you're on a budget. But, if you can get a brand name tablet, please do. A good tablet would be Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (7-Inch, Wi-Fi). My rating has dropped to reflect this recent turn of events.***3/3/13 - I bought this tablet Friday and received it Saturday. This being my first tablet I wasvery excited about it. I still am, but some of that excitment has since been replaced with minor annoyance.The reason I got this tablet was so I could read my Kindle books at the college I go to. I wasn't too thrilled with the lack of features of many other higher end tablets and I don't like iOS. This tablet offers me Android 4.0 which I like. I also like that I can use my 32gb microSD card to boost storage capacity for Spotify and other stuff. So far it has delivered really well and is the only budget tablet I've seen with Google Play.The wifi works ok and I can browse the web fairly quickly. The display isn't the best but performs as expected.What annoyed me first was the touch screen. It tends to be unresponsive much of the time and tests my patience. I found that light taps don't register, so I must tab slightly harder. Not too much harder though. Despite this, it works well enough.The second annoyance is the performance. Keep in mind that it was cheap so I didn't hold high expectations. Under very small loads it works we'll. I can browse the web, listen to Spotify, and have facebook running all at once. Anything more and the performance decreases.The third annoyance is the headphone jack. If I plug my headphones in all the way they won't make a proper connection. So I have to leave them out a small bit. They still fit tight enough not to fall out on their own. Not all headphones will be like this though. My gaming headset plugs in all the way with no issues.Fourth annoyance is the webcam. Where it sits I can't get my face in the frame. This forces me to tilt it which ruins the viewing angel on this cheap display.Fifth annoyance is Skype audio quality. It sounded to me like I was talking to a chipmunk when talking to my girlfriend on Skype. With this and annoyance four, this tablet is unsuitable for decent skype calls. But Skype does work when these issues are overlooked.Sixth annoyance was being told everything I type was spelled wrong. I just turned the spellcheck off.This tablet seems good for the price once these issues are taken into account. It will do what I need.***I wrote the above portion of this review on the tablet without too much of an issue, just so you all know.This tablet will also do Netflix and YouTube really well too.***3/6/13 - Having had a few days with it, I have finally started to get more and more used to this tablet. Honestly, I kind of wish I would have been smarter and just bought a Samsung Galaxy Tab. But, with the lack of money I had to put into it, I would only be getting a 7 inch tablet and maybe a 32gb MicroSD card.One thing I like about the Dragon Touch is that it came rooted. So I could easily bind the directory that Spotify uses on the internal memory to a folder on my MicroSD card. This has worked very well so far. And don't try telling me I could root the Galaxy Tab as well. I just don't have the time or energy to mess with it if something went wrong and I accidentally ruined it. That'd put me out of a lot of money.Here's a quick tip to those who are experiencing performance issues. Don't do very much multitasking. One or two tasks at a time, and no more than three. If you're going to be browsing the web, don't open many tabs. Yes, this is an Android tablet, but keep in mind that it was designed to be an affordable solution with as many features as possible. It isn't meant to be a powerhouse. Also, go into the settings, and under developer options, set the "Window Animation Scale" and the "Transition Animation Scale" to off. If you follow this advice, the tablet should perform better.The touch screen has become a bit less of a pain to use. After awhile, I got used to how it worked and now I have little troubles getting it to respond the first or second times. Again, it's a cheap tablet, what more can one expect? At least it's not a resistive touch screen. I've heard those can be a pain.I have also been able to install a couple of games and they both work very well. The first game I expected to work since the graphics are very basic. The game is called "Zombie Evil". The only issue I've had with it is the touch screen not registering once in a while. Other than that, it works perfectly.The second game is the free version of "Fruit Ninja". This game surprised me. I was expecting it to be the same kind of graphics as "Zombie Evil". But it's actually got some basic 3D in it that reminds me of GTA 3. This tablet pulled it off without any issues whatsoever. The only thing that I've had issues with is connecting with some server to post my scores. All in all, I'm very happy with the tablets performance here.Those are the only two games I've tried, however. I'll keep things up to date until I'm certain that this tablet was worthwhile buy.Now, for those users who own either an Android phone or iPhone who want to have access to internet on this tablet on the go, you might like this. As a Sprint user I was able to, for an extra $20/month (this could change or be different depending on your carrier) on my phone bill, use my Android phone as a mobile hotspot. Granted, this only gives me 2GB of download per month, but I only use it for web browsing when I'm out of the house. When I'm in the house, I use the WiFi I have hooked up to the DSL. So I'm not worried about going over that cap. But it works well for me since I don't have WiFi access at the college I attend. Also makes it easier for me to stay somewhat entertained on the bus to school and back.The battery has held up well enough for me. Not the best battery in the world, but neither is my cellphone. So, I keep my charger with me when I take the tablet out of the house. The battery does take awhile to charge though, which sucks since I'm so impatient. But, it's a small price to pay.The charger itself hasn't broken yet, like a couple of people have reported happening to them. Knock on wood, however. Doing my best to keep it that way. The end that plugs into the tablet has a very tight fit, making it hard to remove. So just be gentle with it as you remove it. Only pull hard enough to remove it, don't tug on it or rip it out of the tablet. Best way to break any charger and/or device it plugs into.Also, don't expect to use this outside under direct sunlight. You won't be able to see it, even on a cloudy gray day, without some cover from the light. Again, another small price to pay.Overall, I still think this tablet was worth it for what I need it for. What you don't pay for in money, you pay for in quality. It's obvious that the manufacturer of this Chinese tablet did their best to sacrifice quality of the less important aspects in order to make an affordable tablet that will perform well enough to do the job that most people will most likely use it for and still have quality where it counts without breaking the bank.My initial rating has not changed so far. I'll keep this up to date until I am sure this tablet won't be a let down in the long run.***3/17/13 - I have had this tablet for two weeks now and it's still going strong. This will probably be the last time I add to this review unless something happens to the tablet to change my mind. But, for now, I believe that this is a good tablet at the price and is worth spending money on if you're thinking about it.If you're looking for a better web browsing experience, I recommend ditching the stock browser and installing Firefox from the Google Play store. Firefox runs smoothly, even with three tabs open at the same time. It's fairly easy to use and it seems to use the available resources efficiently. I don't usually have any issues with it slowing down the tablet or even being asked if I want to close Firefox because it's being unresponsive. It'll still happen sometimes, but far less often.Another thing you may like to know is that this plays not only 2D games relatively well, but I've also been able to play a couple 3D shooters on it as well. The games in question are "Dead Trigger" and "Shadowgun," which are both made by the same developer "Mad Finger Games" and can be installed from the Google Play Store. The games are meant to be played with an NVIDIA Tegra 3 GPU. But the Dragon Touch doesn't sport a Tegra 3. Instead, it uses a Mali-400 GPU. Luckily, these two games are able to use the Mali-400 to pull off some good visuals with very little lag. When I found that I could play these games yesterday, I was highly impressed.As a final note, remember not to go into this thinking that this tablet is going to be a replacement for your desktop or laptop computer. It's not. This tablet, as are most tablets in my opinion, are meant to go alongside a laptop or desktop. The only time I use my tablet is when I am on the go, want to browse the web from my bed, or want to go out into the living room or another place in the house and browse the web from there. Of course, I'll also use it if I just want to play Shadowgun for a bit.I hope I have been helpful. If I can find a reason to not buy this tablet, I'll add it to this review. Until then, I must say that this tablet is well worth it for the price.-- One last thing I almost forgot to add. The Amazon Instant Video client doesn't work on this device. I was unable to install it from the Google Play Store.

Reviews.Title: Mid-grade tablet for low price.
Reviews.Author: Hayward
Reviews.Content: Mid-grade tablet for low price.  It is not the greatest tablet on the market today, but for the size and the operating system, It is a fairly cheap price for what your looking for. I had purchased mine simply for the fact to download games and learning programs for my son, along with a couple of apps for myself.  It was working fine for the first 8-10 days, then the touchpad would not respond to my finger.  I ended up returning the unit in exchange for another one.  This second one that I now have, I have had for a little over a month now with no problems.  Would recommend to the person that does not have a lot of money but is looking for the tablet experience.

Reviews.Title: Love this Tablet - Will Buy Another for 11 Year-old Grandson
Reviews.Author: Sue Smith
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a bit afraid to buy this after all of the negative reviews but I have been buying from Amazon for many years and knew if there was a problem it would be handled to my satisfaction. So.... I bought two of them for my twin 6-1/2 year old granddaughters. These tablets were very easy to set up, to connect to WiFi and then the 6-1/2 year olds got their hands on them and had zero difficulty using them. If there are things my iPad has that these tablets don't I haven't found them yet. The battery life is enough for them to play as long as they want without running out, it recharges quickly and the selection of games from Google is very wide so no complaints there. If I were to make one minor criticism it would be that the monitor is very shiny and sometimes the glare makes it difficult to see but it's not enough of a problem to keep me from buying another one for my 11 year-old grandson! I only bought these on March 10, so I will update this review after we've had them for a while but so far so good!

Reviews.Title: Short Life

Reviews.Content: I ordered this tablet Feb 29,2013 here it is June 2,2013 and with minimal use it stop working ...unit will not power up it should last longer than 3 months you would think

Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted. I ordered a 10 inch sylvania aswell and it's garbage compared to this unit. Need to sell stylus pen with it.

Reviews.Title: LOVED IT FOR THE PRICE-my impressions of this baby ON DAY1
Reviews.Author: JEN
Reviews.Content: Okay..I've been hunting for a cheap budget under 100 usd tab for days and finally I made up my mind and bought this Dragon touch for 84 USD with Amazon Prime..It was unbelievably cheap!What I was looking for-8 Gb or 16 GB internal memory10 inch screen to read better and watch Netflixsupport for 32 or 64 gb ext memoryAndroid 4.2 or higherSkype friendlymust be under 100 usdNew and not used!How I plan to use this tab-My main purpose is to read books in pub/pdf/mobi format on FB reader and Cool readerAlso most common use I intend is to read Amazon  Kindle on a big screen,that's why I looked specifically for 10 inch screen..But all tabs above 9 were like 120 usd or more..So I decided to give this baby a go!Combo of 1o inches screen and 16 GB internal memory seemed ideal to me..But the cheapest tab available for this was 129 USD(unused/new)..So I purchased Dragon Touch..I also want to read lecture notes/power points and word/excel files during my schools and while commuting(it takes me 6 hours to commute every time I go to school)also almost everybody in my class has a tab/laptop and I dont want to carry my laptop all the way..So I bought this one just to fit in!!I am an avid news Junkie and I read a lot and I mean a lot of news articles..Reading them on a big screen(Almost double sized screen than my Samsung Galaxy S4 smartphone!)..is a purpose too!Also,I use Facebook/Twitter a lot..And Thats one of my main use too..I have Samsung s4..which is very good,I am happy with it for Fb/weather/breaking news alerts and music/radio..So I was not looking for these features in my new prospective tab..So in short,my intended uses for this tab-1-Reading E-books and kindle2-News articles on a bigger screen3-Netflix4-Skype5-Readin PDF/Ms word/Ms Excel/Ms powerpoint during the class/lecture and while commuting..In fact eBooks and class power points/pdf are my most intended uses and I am happy so far with both of them!!I saw other tabs too for 94 usd..with good features and it had 3.4 stars on Amazon but I chose this one,as that 3.4 star tab seemed likely to have many fabricated reviews by paid dummies..Please beware!!If you are looking for a tab under 100 usd..You,like me do not want to end up buying a crap product and lose those dollars in vain..I mean..I know how that works:)Also,seller reviews for Tablet Express were 4.7 and favorable reviews were universal..So I went for this one..About seller-Delivery-incredibly fast..I am extremely happy with the seller-Tablet express!Many cheap Tabs are made in China and even on Amazon Prime are shipped from China-Its a trap..Be careful here..As if You wish to return the tab,you have to spend at least 25 USD and you have to use USPS exclusively..It seems like a lot of hustle..You may buy from any seller but be careful of origin of the tab in that case..I live in NJ and the tab shipped from Philly so that was very incredibly swift!!Also,if I wish,I can return it very easily..So this made my decision easier!!So,I basically ordered the tab on 4 March  5 am morn and I have the tab on 5th March 11 Am!!It was incredible!So fast!Unbelievable!!Also it was covered with Amazon prime!!I wanted to use all i can on prime as my free student 6 months prime is ending on 17 mar just 12 days after today..BOOHOO....So I want to make the most of it!Why this mattered is,Amazon is incredibly customer friendly and if we dont get items shipped directly by Amazon,they send us replacement very quickly,almost the next day..So when buying items over like 40 usd its better to buy it with Amazon prime!!Now,the packing-It was a classic Amazon Prime shipmentUnder the prime-box,a solid cardboard box from Tablet Express is used..It was very sturdy and made me confident that the item must have been protected as it shipped..The Tab is thin..Not heavy..It had an extra protective screen even above the original one!!The extra one has instructions written all over it in English/Spanish..Also included in the box are Adapter,USB and user's manual...Also there are 2 colorful post cards asking for installing appkiller from Google play..The tab came totally uncharged..The colord paper asked us to charge the batterey for 10 hours at least before first use(Like that was going to happen!!Duh!!)So,I plugged the adopter in..I started charging it on 11-30..By 12-30 it was like 19%!!So slow comparing to my Samsung S4 which charges like 40-50% in an hour!But its okay,,This baby is bigger and like 7 times cheaper so i don't mind!I started using the tab when it charged up to 58%..And as I used it..The battery use stabilized..Ie..It remained unchanged as it was being used and charged at the same time!As I used it constantly after that,tab took like 8 hours to charge completely for the first time..As I use it..It has charged 20% in 2hours..So I guess,and again this depends on how you use the tab,charging when using is like 10% an hour and idle state charging ranges from 15 to 20% an hour..Not bad!Now the minus points-Remember?Its just 84 USD..And I already use Samsung Galaxy S4 so I have strong opinions on some issues..I want to use this tab for very selected uses as I mentioned earlier.So these minus points are minor to me and if I pull off 6 months or 1 year with this tab,I'd be very happy!1-Compared to s4,its sluggish!2-It has 8GB internal memory but only 5.36 GB is available for actual use(Tab wins vs s4 in this one actually,as s4 has 16 GB internal memory but allows me to use only 9.2GB!)3-Its touch screen is very less responsive esp after getting used to s4!4-Its charging is slow,very much so than s4!AS s4 costs 600 USD(less these days though and the Tab is 84!)5-Support for external memory card is limited to 32 Gb,I have 64 Gb card in my phone!!6-Screen resolution is not HDMI..But to make it better,I kept the brightness almost at maximum and that does the trick..Not as spectacular as s4,but display is reasonably good..7-Tab gets discharged comparatively rapidly..That sucks..As I used..Battery lasts for almost 4.5 to 5 hours..But I have many apps running in the background which eats up the battery!!8-It lags sometimes while starting up and starting apps..But after a while it became smooth and now ts working alright...Slower than phone but not bothersome.9-It doesn't support Tune in radio which sucks!10-Ummm,Not much,but It supports upto 200 apps easily so far..This is 900 in s4!!I dunno how many more does the tab supports maximum,I will find out and update!11-Its not very good for multi tasking..Though it holds up fine when I use it to read and listen to songs simultaneously!!Though I can listen to music on my phone while reading on tab too,which seems better!Some resolved issues-1-At first it didnt recognize my sd card!I panicked..But after formatting the card like 3 times and trying on and on,the tab gave in and now it recognizes the sd card and reads smooth...No problem now..2-It came totally uncharged so we cannot test it right away!3-The android version is 4.2 but higher versions of the system are available already!Though if you are not a techie/geek,you shouldnt worry about this issue i think!4-I wish it was more square-ish in look rather than totally rectengular!Bt for 84 usd price its okay!5-It gets hanged while opening apps sometime,though this problem has become less troublesome over time!!Over all-Did I like it-YESAm I happy?_You bet!Is it worth the money?-Yes,so farDoes it have card slot/google play/skype/email/mp3/mp4/Netflix support-YESIt supports upto 32 GB external sd/Flash/TF cardIt supports epub,kindle,word,excel,powerpoint,doc,Mobi all formats..SOme recommended apps-All available on Google play and supported by the device-Fb,Tweetcaster,App2sd,appkiller,Rocket music player,cool reader,amazon kindle,News Republic,Quickpic,Skype,Netflix,Quickoffice,IM+,CNN,MSNBC,FOX,ABC,CBS news..Accuweather,1weather,Politico,Political digest,your local NBC news/weather app,NY times,Israel hayom,Jpost,Israel national news..FB reader,Cool reader,moon reader,aldiko reader,Air reader..Free dictionary,Eng-Spanish dictionary,Goodreads,Meet me,Tetris by Ea sports,Fruit Ninja,Angry birds,Some fears I had about the tab and how I feel about them after using it?-Connectivity to wi-fi..My room has 3 devices,1 lop-top and s4 and this tab competing for already relatively weak Wi-Fi..Its a reception problem due to location and angle of my room..The reception is much better in the living room and in my roommates room,But not so in poor lil me's room..But the wi-fi works fine on tab..Its almost 12 hours already and it has worked perfect!Never disconnected by it self,also reconnects on start up..-Speed-its okay....Good for the intended uses I have in my mind-Sensitivity of the touch screen-Much less than s4 but its functional and once you get the hang of it..you won't mark the difference at all!-Supports my fav apps(the list of apps above)-It does!!And other than Tune in/Stitcher radio apps(for my political/news radio interest) all apps i uses are already supported!-External memory card-yes,it supports 32 Gb or less TF/SD cards!!-Does it lag/hang up-Not much so far..Sluggish than s4 but functionality is not jeopardized!-Will my apps be supported?-Yes,as the tab comes with Google play stores,you can use almost any app available for 4.2 Android version..-Hows the camera?-Bad!!Do not use tab for this purpose..It has 2 cameras,very low resolution..So you can Skype with it..And it works fine!-Supports Skype and Netflix?-YES!!-How many apps are installed already-Not many,some 12-20 apps,including Google play,music player,video player and camera etc plus Adobe PDF reader are per-installed..But you have Google play and you can download any app you wish!!-Does it support push notifications??-I am a big fan of this feature as I am very used to check weather and breaking news all the time..I find apps with push notifications very very useful...The notification bar is i the lowermost part of the tab screen and I am used to use it from the other extreme ll,so it will take some time for me to get used to it..Also,its not as sharp as s4 in this push notification issue!But I already have the phone for this use so I don't think its a big issue for me:)-Games-I am not that into games..The tab supports almost all of my girly games tho:)And popular games like Fruit ninja and Angry birds work just fine too.I will use more games and update here..Bottom-line(s)-I know what you are looking for!I was there till last 2 days!I have seen many many tabs from amazon and eBay and Google!And after reading g hundreds of reviews I took a chance with this tab..I am happy so far,.But as soon as that changes,I will update my review..I would strongly recommend this budget tab if-1-you,like me are a student and want to use the tab for functionality/in class work etc and not to show off!2-To read eBooks and news on a big screen,3-Netflix and Skype-Okay4-Much better if you have a better smartphone like me..Than you can go with this tab!5-NO!You cannot replace your smartphone/lap top with a tab like this..It is sold for 84 USD for a reason!6-It would make a good gift for a first time user or your 10-12 YO kids..7-If you are not much tech savvy,this tab is for you!!8-Overall 5 stars from me at this point of time..I will update here regularly and answer questions  too..I will update even more as days go by and if I find something worth of sharing!!Having been through all this,I guess I can be helpful to you!!If you have questions about the tab,leave your comments below and I will try to answer lol:)Happy Tab hunting !!

Reviews.Content: Delivered in time, no scratches or breaks, fully operational, WiFi is good, sounds well, the screen is large enough to watch movies... That's all you need from a 100$ tablet. High five!

Reviews.Title: Bad purchase
Reviews.Author: Thelma G.
Reviews.Content: Only thing that was great about my order is that it was on time my table was broken when I received it

Reviews.Title: The difference between Apple and everyone else is that Apple would never allow such garbage to be released.
Reviews.Author: Matt Ruby
Reviews.Content: The difference between Apple and everyone else is that Apple would never allow such garbage to be released.  I'm one of the few left on the planet that still had not bought a tablet.  I've been through a few generations of Iphones but did not think the high price for an Ipad could be worth it and there must be an alternative, so I went searching.I did not have high expectations at all in spending less than 100 bucks, I wanted to simply get the look and feel of a different OS, the different apps and how things flow etc., before spending an appropriate amount for an Apple tablet alternative.  I had no idea however, that a manufacturer could have the shameless disregard for the public and instead, rely on suckers like myself to prey upon.This thing is so slow its painful, really painful.  For a comparison, I pulled my Iphone 3 out of the drawer with no cell service but still works when connected to wifi.  So with both the Dragon tablet and the old Iphone 3, connected to the same wifi, both within10 feet of the router, I went through a handful of basic tasks.  Pull up the home page of a browser, go to a given site, just navigate between apps, really anything I tried, no matter how simple the task, the old dusty Iphone crushed the performance of the Dragon Touch I just had taken out of the box.This Dragon Touch is by far the largest piece of electronic garbage I have ever purchased in my life.  And for perspective, I started off my tech life with an Apple IIE, the one with the green pixel screen, anyone remember that?  I've been through all the Microsoft windows stuff starting with Windows II and up running on a x386, x 486 etc.  I have a rich history of tech products dating back over 25 years now, and nothing in my history comes close to how bad this Dragon Touch tablet is.I wish I had donated the money to some worthy cause rather than lining the pockets of the company that preys on the public and unsuspecting and uninformed people like me who thought they did some homework.  I'm the dope, and by way of my wasted money take responsibility.  Learn from me and dont make the same mistake.  Save yourself and your money if you are thinking of buying this piece of garbage. Quickly now, run!  Put your tail between your legs, drink some Gatorade and run as fast as you can from any thought that you might buy this thing.Really, you are better than this.  I dont know you dear reader of this review but, any further purchases of this thing is a crime against humanity and all of us tech public that just want reasonable quality for a reasonable cost.  I expected to get what I paid for, low quality for low cost, not no quality for low cost.Yours in begging for no further purchases of this garbage,Matt in NYC

Reviews.Title: DRAGON TABLET
Reviews.Author: Tony Miller
Reviews.Content: TO ALL THE HYPE OUT THERE ABOUT HOW SUCKY THIS PRODUCT IS ( YOUR WRONG ) A GOOD INTERNET CONNECTION CLEARS ALL THAT UP YOU TUBE I GET ON FINE FACEBOOK, NETFLICKS ETC......IT IS ANDROID FRENDLY AND IS CAPABLE OF BEING DROP SEVERAL TIMES BY MY LITTLE ONE AND KEEP ON RUNNING I HAVE DOWNLOADED MANY APPS AND SAVED OVER 20 + MOVIES ON IT AND IT IS BY FAR A CHEAP WAY TO GO IF YOUR LOOKING FOR A GOOD TABLET.BUT I MUST SAY I HAVE ONLY HAD THE PRODUCT FOR ( ONLY ) 4 MONTHS I USE THE HEAD SET JACK EVERYDAY.  MY SON LISTENS TO MUSIC AND WATCHES MOVIES ALMOST EVERY DAY AND I HAVE NOT HAD A PROBLEM YET.I LIKE THE PRODUCT VERY MUCH AND I WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO A FRIENDO BY THE WAY A SCREEN PROTECTOR IS A MUST

Reviews.Title: Under powered and poor battery
Reviews.Author: John Herms
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 5 yr. old grandson who loves to watch youtube videos and play game apps.  He can't.  Videos won't load. And it has Adobe Flash 11 loaded in the apps. This tab clocks to eternity on embedded videos and youtube videos.  So you cannot enjoy the full internet experience.  Takes 10 hours to charge battery and it lasts only a few hours.  Others have reported these problems also in their reviews.  Thought it was possibly not the norm.  But is seems to be.  Even at $99 I cannot recommend even for a 5 yr. old.

Reviews.Title: Dragon Touch Tablet
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM E. REESE
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with the tablet until it would not take a charge. I would not buy the same tablet as a replacement because i was not able to contact Tablet Express customer service. Their customer service is nothing like Amazons.  Bill Reese

Reviews.Title: Not a good tablet
Reviews.Author: nkb
Reviews.Content: I brought this tablet 6 months and power button not function and screen only showing dragon touch logo. Won't go to main screen.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this item
Reviews.Author: Susan Rugoletti
Reviews.Content: This item didn't work after 1 month returned it for another and that broke down within a month not a good product

Reviews.Title: Stopped working right after time limit to return
Reviews.Author: CONSTANCE EVANS
Reviews.Content: Wasted money!  Couldn't return and had to throw in the garbage.  Total waste of money.  Very disappointing and not usual for Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet so far.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Parker
Reviews.Content: I would first like to address all the reviews about the poor battery life.  First off, the first thing you read when you open the box is a page that says charge your new dragon touch for ten hours upon arrival.  Then use the tablet until battery dies, and charge again for a full ten hours without use.  Now the purpose of this is to make sure that in the future you get FULL battery potential with your tablet.  Plus it helps to download a juice defender app to pro long battery life.  I even have it on my phone.  Everything on the tablet has worked great for me thus far.  I bought it for my wife as a birthday gift and she loves it.  Plenty of room for downloads, pictures, videos, etc.  OS is sound and download/upload speeds are quick.  Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Likes and Dislikes
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline P. McCarthy
Reviews.Content: I like the tablet except for taking pictures. If taking pictures wasn't a major factor or someone, I would recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: problem
Reviews.Author: javier
Reviews.Content: Q You do not know about the battery from the moment that I received the tablet, I get a message (low voltage or power, usb Derice does not work) and the tablet will download quickly. the rest I have no problem

Reviews.Title: dragon touch 9" goolge tablet
Reviews.Author: Tammy Long
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy using my dragon touch tablet . I would recommend this product . It is easy to use

Reviews.Title: Don't buy!
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This device stopped working within 5 days of using it.  I would not recommend this to a dog let alone another human being.

Reviews.Title: NO USB access
Reviews.Author: shahe jierian
Reviews.Content: looking to insert a USB area but none exists .. I thought inserting a USB with information is something you should be able to do on a tablet

Reviews.Title: WASTE OF MONEY
Reviews.Author: Joanne Spears
Reviews.Content: DID NOT WORK AT ALL!  WOULD NOT HOLD A CHARGE, EITHER ONE,(I BOUGHT 2,BIG MISTAKE). ONLY TIME IT WOULD WORK IS WHEN IT WAS PLUGGED INTO CHARGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very poor wifi connection
Reviews.Author: Greg R. Eidam
Reviews.Content: The unit has very poor WiFi connection ability. It wouldn't pick up the WiFi in our house from one room away. It would only work if I was sitting right at the modem

Reviews.Title: color is bad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Color is off on my Dragon touch very blue and blurry.Camera Is real bad when you try to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: This sucks
Reviews.Author: Riva Butler
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother to have during Thanksgiving at the beach to enjoy. I am let down because not only does it not work but Thanksgiving is next week. Very disappointed.  I even ordered the case for it which I am also returning.  Will trust this brand name anymore.  Amazon doesn't have the option of replacement order either.  This sucks.

Reviews.Title: new tablet
Reviews.Author: Laure A. Kasper
Reviews.Content: i loved playing with it... had it about a week and then it would not turn on...planning on returning it but getting another one... people have noted some problems...i still like it the size apps worked... this is my second tablet the first one i got was from big lots... this one can do a lot more... i love the size too coming from a 7 in to a 9 in is wonderful. already order and will return the other... it is a pain to do the returns but amazon is great!

Reviews.Title: cheap quality
Reviews.Author: winifred owusu
Reviews.Content: this tablet doesnt support any apps.l am ver frustrated with it,the seller also stated that it should be returned new and intact,how can you return something when you havent use it.so am stuck with something i dont want.so like l said i will not buy any electronics from amazon.maybe music and others.

Reviews.Title: DRAGON TOUCH
Reviews.Author: Visa Platinum "BIR"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is good for the price and works well ,my son loves it. Great investment for the kids .

Reviews.Title: One hundred dollars in the trash!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ten Inch Heels
Reviews.Content: This tablet lasted 1 month and operating system went bad. No response from customer service and no where to purchase operating system. One hundred dollars in the trash!!!!!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Shawnte
Reviews.Content: It is a nice tablet, I would not order another one though. Kind of slow, but if you download Google Chrome it's not that bad. Screen will go black if too many apps are left open. This was my first Android Tablet, and I am enjoying it. I am going to give it to my 5 year old and buy me a more expensive tab. You get what you pay for.. Good for downloading games and music. Great for children and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: Dislike/Missing  App
Reviews.Author: Mazen AlQatia
Reviews.Content: My main issue with this product was the internet browser which was not good for me and was getting me nerves. The situation was improved after installing firefox browser. I can't download and watch videos like from youtube because a abode flash player which is not provided as a software.

Reviews.Title: affordable
Reviews.Author: Kristine
Reviews.Content: Not bad for what the money value you pay for it is. Very light and a bit sdmaller than I imagined it would be ... Connects easy to WiFi but has quit a lag if you download programs. Got 3 games and when playing one it lags like crazy. Battery life isnt very long. all together still worth the small amount i paid for ... gets the job done. im happy with it

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: michael proulx
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet so my 14 yr old would have something to play with while we travel. He watches movies, plays music and has games on it. it has been six months now with no problems with it. i love that you can increase memory by adding a card which my wife can not do with her ipad.

Reviews.Title: Eh, you get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: MarkM
Reviews.Content: I had to return this product after 2 days of using it. I figured after reading the top review I should go ahead and buy it. I did not expect anything incredibly awesome from this tablet since it was only 78$. I figured I could browse the web, watch movies and play some games from the app store. The internet is as slow as dial up, even when I try to google search it takes time to load. When on facebook or youtube, the website would freeze and a message saying browser is not responding.The tablet itelf is not very responsive, most times when you touch an icon, there is a couple seconds delay. There is even a delay on the virtual keyboard which got me frustrated the most.One other thing, sometimes the screen would not turn back on when I would press the power button. I would have to shut off the the tablet completely and reboot it in order to get the screen to show again.I figured for 78$ and the top review I would give it a shot, but after testing it out, I did not want to take any chances with it. I returned it and decided to spend twice the amount on the new Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Weak frame
Reviews.Author: Amr Arafat
Reviews.Content: It is Ok for children because of its specsI purchased it 3 months ago and it is still working! Despite the external frame had some damage and the charger is broken inside itI use USB charger now which I've noticed to be slower than the other onegood tab for school children, I recommend memory expansion with mircoSD card. I use 32 GB and it works well

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: KS
Reviews.Content: Great price for a good tablet. This tablet runs a little slow, and screen resolution is on the low side.

Reviews.Title: Very Very slow after 2 weeks of light use.. Maybe total of 7 hours
Reviews.Author: Nikkii Rogers
Reviews.Content: Buyers Remorse, You should spend a little more, and get a better one :( These is not what you want.. Bought 7" and 9" Dragon Touch and 7" will not even load after first week. 9" is very very slow after 2 week

Reviews.Title: Great!! (for the price)
Reviews.Author: Breanna S.
Reviews.Content: This product was and is great. Especially for the price. I studied peoples reviews before buying it though just to be on the safe side. Knowing if an off brand and it cheap...makes me suspicious right? It took no time at all to be delivered to me. This is great for games and other apps but it sometimes freezes up. the screen quality and touch quality is great but like i said I have learned to only use it for games and other apps. Browsing the web confuses the poor thing and the whole tablet will freeze up and youll have to shut it off and turn it back on. The battery life is pretty good which surprised me. All in all i love my tablet (you get what you pay for)  :)

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Poseison
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly fine first tablet but it is buggy and slow. For the price its a downright steal!

Reviews.Title: Item arrived promptly and as described
Reviews.Author: Greg Riley
Reviews.Content: It was about the quality I expected at this price point. It was easy to configure to our home network, and kids were using within an hour of arrival.

Reviews.Title: 9" google Android
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Just got this this evening, It is so easy to set up.  It is really easy to download apps for it.  The touch screen is reallynice just a little tap on it.  My wife really loves it.  Will be getting another for my daughter.

Reviews.Title: Nice product! and very functional
Reviews.Author: Gilberto Gomez
Reviews.Content: I bought this product as a gift for my Cousin, nice features, very functional... no regrets at all!I you want a non expensive tablet, this one is the right option.

Reviews.Title: 9" Tabet
Reviews.Author: phylee
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my granddaughter to take to her college classes.  It is a great item and easy to use.  I'm planning on buying one for myself.

Reviews.Title: I had high hopes
Reviews.Author: JoAnn M Cahill
Reviews.Content: this tablet has been such a disappointment.  like others before me, i had to have the charger replaced.  i had also heard that it had a short battery life.  that was an understatement.  i have charged the battery many times to 100%, unplugged the power to time how long it would really last while i played solitair.  the first try, it shut off after two minutes, the second try was also @ 2minutes. the third try was only one full minute, and when i plugged it back in the third time, it told me that it had an encryption error and needed to run a full reset. luckily i had only loaded free apps on the device.  now i am faced with the decision of what to do with this.  I think that i've had it too long to get a refund.

Reviews.Title: perfect!
Reviews.Author: revpeg
Reviews.Content: if you want a reasonable priced tablet this is your baby....I liked it so much I've purchased one for a gift

Reviews.Title: Not user friendly
Reviews.Author: Ld
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big tech person and this device was not user friendly from the start. It didn't take you step by step to get started.

Reviews.Title: gave it as a gift
Reviews.Author: SmarteeGirl13
Reviews.Content: it was an excellant purchase - was given to my son as a gift - that was quite a few months ago and he is still loving it!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Betsy Waddell
Reviews.Content: This has become a replacement for my laptop when I want to access apps and internet in a quick step. I have found it is very easy to download the apps you want and quickly brings up internet pages with ease. I still use my laptop for regular computer needs, but this tablet is the one I grab when time is of the essence.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Randolfo Ortiz "good advice"
Reviews.Content: Like some people say you get what you pay for you can never compare this to a well known market brand

Reviews.Title: Almost a perfect tablet
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This tablet is easy to learn, easy to figure out how to operate, works smoothly. It does everything I wanted it to do. The only thing that I don't like is it doesn't have an SD card slot (it has an oddball TF card slot. I would love this tablet if it had a full-size SD card slot and a full-size USB port (it has a mini-USB port).

Reviews.Title: too many problems
Reviews.Author: Busymom
Reviews.Content: Within a week the charger broke. The charger is very flimsy. I ended up charging it with my USB phone charger. The tablet operates very slow, especially using Netflix which is one of the main reasons I bought it. The touch screen was inconsistent...super sensitive with some apps and completely unresponsive with other apps like Netflix. After a month, the tablet wouldn't turn on even after being charged. Thank goodness it still in the return window because I am returning for a refund. I was hoping this would be an ok product for the price, but it only lasted a month and was frustrating to use while It was working. It is worth it to spend more to get a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Tablet handy but minor problems
Reviews.Author: Mas Fleischer
Reviews.Content: I like having the tablet for conveneince, but when holding the unit horizontally, the go back button will not function.

Reviews.Title: Would NOT recommend
Reviews.Author: J. Bartlett "ERdoc"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these for my kids instead of buying an in-car entertainment system with a new van purchase.I'm very disappointed in this device.I purchased via Amazon, they both arrived new as described.BOTH units have had the same issues.I'm no novice to electronics or the Android OS.This system/CPU is VERY slow -- but I was expecting that as they were only $109 (now down to $99 I see).I wanted them to do basic free games, but mostly to play MP4 movies -- they do play the movies that I put on an external miniSD card.The issue is with the software -- it constantly freezes doing any type of activity on the device.It constantly hangs and needs to be reset -- this happens to both units, so we didn't get a dud.Neither have ever been dropped or had any hacks to the Android software and there are no updates for the software.Both devices now will not hold any battery charge at all and we have only owned them for 2 months. Extremely frustrating.They both are now useless as we can't use them in the car since they have to remain plugged in to use, which now only 1 can do that, the other won't even allow to use or boot up being plugged in.This is a horrible device and I highly do NOT recommend. I would never buy it again, even for the cheap one hundred bucks.Please don't make the mistake that I did. Now I need to again buy more devices. Likely Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Not happy With the sellers
Reviews.Author: edgarlopez
Reviews.Content: First of all every electronic i have ever bought has a one year manufacturer warranty. so it happens that this product has a 90 day... That is the worst buy i ever done in my life. Do not buy from the seller @ tabletexpress.com you will regret it as I am right now.Poor Customer service when you call.They say Hello not thanks for calling tablet express how may I direct your call....Very unprofessional of them.....

Reviews.Title: My 9in Dragon Touch,
Reviews.Author: jammice mcfall
Reviews.Content: I like it,but i have read sum of the reviews and they seem to be about just like i feel over this;Mine runs slow at times and says not responding while i was downloading things it needs; Like protection and google chrome,Facebook,This was my first time touching it since i ordered it in Nov~2013 its for My son for xmas..Which i just started useing yesterday 12~13~13 to set up for my son ,So that makes me really wonder if i should even use it,,, if i've only started setting it up and downloading stuff to use it..?... should i even rate this Dragon Touch... PLUS I NEVER RECEIVED MY CHARGER and USB CABLE WITH MY DRAGON TOUCH 9 IN GOOGLE ANDROID,IT ONLY CAME WITH THE DIRECTIONS. I did buy the purple tablet folder to go with it. Its a nice set together,Which i should of gotten black or blue for my son..Well i'll just order another folder.. So now i can only wait til my son opens it to use before i can say some more;HOPEFULLY ALL GOOD.. Hope this helps others have Happy holidays.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Michael Mercadante
Reviews.Content: For the price, it seems to do everything a tablet should do. Did not like the lack of instructions on the (one sheet) "manual" however. Even on the Dragon Touch website, the info was very lacking and it took me a while to just figure out what type of memory card I needed. The only info I could find was an arrow on a diagram stating "TF Card Slot".

Reviews.Title: Sluggish!
Reviews.Author: Rachel Bobb
Reviews.Content: For the price it cost... I guess i got what i paid for... It is not the best one that i have used , and linking to the internet  and other things like the android  market are very sluggish and totally annoying. It takes forever to load pages

Reviews.Title: Tablet yes, table & keyboard pair NO!!
Reviews.Author: Alicia Ivey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet and the keyboard cover together as offered because I wanted the ease of having a smaller computer than my laptop for traveling.  I picked this tablet because it showed the keyboard case as an viable option to having to use the stylis pen or the actual screen.  I like the spead the keyboard option offers but to my dismay when I received my order I found that this tablet doesn't have any usb ports at all so there was no way to connect the keyboard to it.  I emailed the seller but haven't heard anything back so I sent it back and will be ordering a replacement one that has the usb port. NOTE** If you plan on connecting anything to a tablet besure to purchase usb adaptors or simply find a tablet with at least 1 usb port.

Reviews.Title: problem authenticating with my wireless modom
Reviews.Author: Antoine
Reviews.Content: I workt on it more than 3 houres what ever I did never was able to get it to workkeeps telling me authentication problem ,so I did return it and hope to fine something that works properly

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: Les Stockett
Reviews.Content: I wanted a table to check Gmail, SKYPE & Facebook. I thought they were simple needs,and this cheap product would be able to handle itI loaded the Facebook & SKYPE app. Gmail I used through the internet explorer.Both SKYPE & Facebook had major issues. 2-3 timeouts before actually getting toa screen. Sending an email in Gmail took nearly 60 seconds after hitting send(4 lines, no attachment)I took a swing, but you would have to pay me for lost time to usethis product

Reviews.Title: Bang for your Buck
Reviews.Author: cmkelly
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for three months and and this is my review so far:I want to start of by saying I would rather give this a 4.5 star rating not just a 4 star.The Good:Only $110 when I bought it (can't easily beat that price for a tablet). The screen is big which makes email, facebook easy to use and videos are clear. External Memory, I had a microSD card from my phone that I wasn't using anymore and being able to add more memory is always nice. The battery life is awesome I can run facebook and email for 3 to 4 days without charging.The Bad:The Web Browser stops responding rather frequently but once you tap wait it generally jumps to what you wanted to do. The speaker is not very loud but because the tablet comes with headphones that is easily taken care of.Neutral:You don't have a lot of space on the screen to put Icons but if you use folders it's not a problem. Plus I only use a few news apps, email, facebook and a word processor.Overall:I paid very little and just wanted a way to work on files for school and check email while on the go and a tablet was exactly what I wanted. I don't play games on it so I can't comment on how that works, although the internet is frustrating at times all other apps I have downloaded work without delays. I strongly recommend this as a starter tablet or if you are like me and just need something to use on the go and don't plan to run several programs lots at once. Especially if you remember that you aren't paying a lot you will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: Not a brand name.
Reviews.Author: Deborah Carter
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this particular tablet.  It is very slow and is not always able to connect to the internet.

Reviews.Title: battery sux
Reviews.Author: Bryant Stewart
Reviews.Content: I have  had this tablet for a while not a bad product for the price but after a while it will not hold charge for more than two hours. Prepare to keep it on the charger at all times!!

Reviews.Title: Awful tablet
Reviews.Author: Marcela V.
Reviews.Content: My son was super excited when he received this tablet for Christmas. Excitement was short lived when he found out how slow and uncooperative this tablet was.I have tried to return it but weather had different plans for us and we got stuck for days in the house due to snow storm and I have missed the time window I could return it. Well, it sits here and collect the dust.Slowest tablet out there, pick different one!

Reviews.Title: worst by every
Reviews.Author: rondel
Reviews.Content: I brought this item has a mother gift for my wife and the audio not working , so she cannot hear a thing on the tablet

Reviews.Title: Deserves ZERO stars
Reviews.Author: WeeGrunge "WeeGrunge"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my parents to try out. I installed a few games I knew they would like and set them up with an email account. They never did learn how to send email before these crazy pop-ups started taking over the tablet. Not advertisements, but pop-ups like the weather, the speaker control, and then the apps do not work. It freezes up and it's a total piece of crap. I purchased it in November, sent it to them in December for Christmas and by February it was not working. Very disappointing because my parents had wifi installed and they have no device now.

Reviews.Title: love it, love it, love it :)
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Wade Jr
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Dragon Tablet. Easy to learn to use, light weight, and everything l hoped it would be. A total success.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed
Reviews.Author: Misty Taylor
Reviews.Content: This product was just as we expected.  Great quality good battery life and takes wonderful pictures.  Just the right size not too big nor too small.

Reviews.Title: pretty bad but ok until it died
Reviews.Author: Amazonshopper098
Reviews.Content: I recieved this as a gift. Let me start out by saying it is an ok tablet. I had it for a few months. It worked as advertised. Recently it has been uninstalling apps and literally, not kidding been giving me 10 error messages a second. I tuned off and now cant get it back on. The casing feels very cheap because it is. It frequently comes off at random. The last time it came off it snapped my sd card in half. The os is different than that of the picture. Everything is at a bottom taskbar which is fine with me but a little disappointing at first. The web browser sucks. I tested it against my kindle touch on the same wifi network and my kindle won. In conclusion this is a good tablet but you must act as soon as you see a problem otherwise you will end up like me. I will go buy a different tablet

Reviews.Title: I Like it but .......
Reviews.Author: Alisha Jackson
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone as far as the speed of the tablet. Other than that its a good tablet for the price. The keyboard is a little cheap but Its still what I expected. I mainly got the case to protect my tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great reader
Reviews.Author: supreme coolness
Reviews.Content: This reader is very handy and is a very good size to use.  It is easy to read and page turns work well.  It also accesses the web easily and works well in other functions.  All in all, a good buy.  The only complaint I have is that the antenna doesn't seem to be real sensitive, meaning that I have to be close to a WIFI source to get onto the web.

Reviews.Title: save your money
Reviews.Author: Qster1719
Reviews.Content: This unit cannot go the distance.  I purchased it for my husband and he still uses my ipad..  It freezes up and does not perform very well.  Waste of money in my opinion.  It does not do searches very well.  The only thing he uses it for is Angry Birds now.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: Carmella
Reviews.Content: the item was always turning off even though it was fully charged. In the end it it turned off for two days, then when it came on there were all these lines completely covering the screen. No home screen was showing. Then to be even more annoying, it was making a loud humming noise. saving up for a better brand.

Reviews.Title: Product recommendation
Reviews.Author: Ender Rafael Guedez Alvarado
Reviews.Content: excellent product easy to handle recommend as it is very good and the person is also very responsible and kind thank you very much

Reviews.Title: worst buy
Reviews.Author: Antonio juarez
Reviews.Content: This is the worst buy I ever made it broke down the first week and I can't get it replace

Reviews.Title: good buy except charger broke
Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: I am very glad I got this tablet actually bought 2 of them they arrived on time and the 9" screen will not disappoint.  Ok so I changed this from 5 stars to 3 because I ordered two of these tablets and they are still nice other than the slow run time sometimes and the annoying low voltage alert. but my biggest problem is one of the chargers does not work already I don't know if it happened during shipment or what but I think it should work for longer than ONE OR TWO CHARGES

Reviews.Title: A Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Boyzandme
Reviews.Content: I am happy that i purchased this tablet for my son.  I am very pleased with the touch screen capability, the speed of the harddrive and the 8GB of memory.  I purchased additional memory because I know my son would appreciate the ability to download mass amounts of music, games and vines.  I would definitely recommend this to someone.  I am thinking of purchasing one for myself in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Cheap cheap
Reviews.Author: Olive
Reviews.Content: The display is terrible. The buttons inverted and got stuck. I had to continuously press hard in order for the screen to register. Ugh! Complete waste of money... Im thinking of getting the samsung tablet or ipad

Reviews.Title: Product is as described but unfortunately you get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Alex Youman
Reviews.Content: This thing is very, very slow. I even turned off all animations and use a clean up app constantly. This helped a little but its so slow its almost unusable. The screen is the same as the 7" screen just stretched and its very dim and has a glare problem. Also the battery lifetime is really bad especially for a device that doesn't have that much power. This could be a good devise for a kid, but I don't know why any kid would need a tablet...

Reviews.Title: dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Camera was absolutely blurry, not easy to use. Advertised as kid friendly, but I have to disagree. Very dissatisfied customer

Reviews.Title: Where to start
Reviews.Author: Phillip
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for a 3 year old to keep him off Ipads. I didn't honestly expect much. But with the claimed power in this I didn't expect it to be so sluggish it wouldn't be playable. Even youtube videos are so sluggish I got tired of the pauses and give him an ipad. However, I figured I would try to upgrade the firmware or find a custom rom for it.First the firmware. None work better than what it comes installed with. It's that simple you lose all wifi ability with I'm assuming all 3 of the versions out. The second one is the best of the bunch it at least gives you back touch BUT you have to learn where to touch the calibration is off drastically. And you can never get wifi to enable.Second custom rom. If anyone finds one let me know. Apparently this isn't one of those cheap tablets that when rooted makes a decent piece of equipment. So there are none.Finally their support. Well for a  "US based manufacturer and distributer" (quoted straight from their site) the email that bounced back was apparently based in the UK. OK outsourcing (technically offshoring if outside the US) is common place but the point is they obviously didn't receive my email either.So to sum up, If you want to spend $60 I would look at anything other than the Dragon Touch line.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift for my adult son,he reports that he was amazed by the quality of this tablet,it's functions and accessibility.and plans to buy a second one for his son..Priced right.Good value,

Reviews.Title: Okay tablet
Reviews.Author: robert
Reviews.Content: Not the fastest tablet, but okay for the low price. Good for email and as an ebook reader. Good size screen, but not very bright for outside or brightly lit room use.

Reviews.Title: It's a good Tablet PC
Reviews.Author: Lloyd c Blanks
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap but effective Tablet PC and I believe I found it.  The PC charges and works at a satisfying level. It has all the computing power I need.

Reviews.Title: Nice size better price
Reviews.Author: Terrance
Reviews.Content: So I was looking everywhere in stores for a tablet and couldn't find one at a reasonable price as soon I looked on amazon found on, nice size screen good price in stores this was the price for a 7" tablet so I'm very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: just dreadful
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: doesn't hold a charge. Only useful when plugged in with it's very short charger. VERY SLOW, waited at least 5min for the browser to load. Just returned it

Reviews.Title: Well worth $90!!!
Reviews.Author: Rema
Reviews.Content: We have had our 9" 8gb Dradon Touch for about a week now. I bought this for my 7 yr old son who loves anything electronic. He's mature enough to have something like this and he takes very well care of his things. I wanted something that wasn't too big or too small, also a tablet that wasn't too kiddyish, as well as something that i wasn't going to get sick over if it was to break or get lost.. This tablet does pretty much everything that my iPad does. He can download most of the App games that are available on the iPad... EVEN NETFLIX! The sound is really good and the picture is really good BUT the screen fades as it is turned at an angle, but we can deal with this. Also, when taking pics, the quality is very poor, I haven gotten the chance to video chat yet though to see the quality.... This product was not charged AT ALL, that's kind of like buying a car and you have to fill it yourself the first time. But at least it worked :) As of downloading apps: I was very surprised at how fast his apps download. Netflix: The picture is a little blurred for just a few seconds and the quality is great after that with no glitches.......Overall, I am very pleased with my sons Dragon touch and so far I do not regret a penny of it.... Oh, a screen protector would've been great to have came with, just a thought.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Arthur Baxter
Reviews.Content: Purchased the tablet with low expectations, figured that it would only run one app a time. They system didn't even perform that task all that well. Had it 2 weeks and the system seemed to get worse each day. By the time i was ready to send it back the system would restart on its own at random times. Couldn't surf web, or watch movies with out it freezing. I may have just got a lemon, but i figured i would spend a bit more of a quality tablet the next time. The system had 512 RAM but the OS used up almost 1/2 of it, with left very little to run apps effectively. For another $80 I got an replacement tablet that is 10x better.

Reviews.Title: Really Happy

Reviews.Content: Perfect for my needs, the price can't be beat for the quality of the item, it has even caused a few Ipad users to take a second look at it, and wonder why they paid so much.

Hers only lasted a week. Hers would turn on, but would not go past the Dragon Touch loading screen. At least she was able to return it. So, if you want to give this thing a try, make sure to use it immediately.

I got a Samsung 10" galaxy tab3. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Rothrhin
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a favor and move on to something else. While searching for a Christmas present for my mother I came across this tablet. The specs all seemed great for the price with things like the android operating system, double camera features, and 8GB of memory; man was I disappointed. The operation system is unbelievably slow, disregard multitasking in any sense. Apps took entirely too long to install/load, and you could perform no other tasks while downloading else the tablet would freeze or powerdown. Forget about watching videos of any kind; we tried netflix and youtube, even on the lowest video settings the videos took an unreasonable time to load or would not load at all. Both cameras share clarity/picture quality of a flip phone from 1999, and there is no flash. The touch screen is glitchy, even simple flash games such as Fruit Ninja and Candy Crush were slow/unresponsive and timed out. If you wish to spend over $100 for a paperweight, this is the tablet for you. This device is simply horrible.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had this tablet for not even 1 year and can no longer use it.  The USB port and the charger port both stopped working.  The USB went first and I was unable to use my keyboard case.  A month or so later I noticed that it was not fully charged after having it plugged in over night.  I was able to fix this by wiggling the power cord.  That worked ok for a bit but now there is nothing I can do to get it to charge.  As of today it's sitting here, dead.  Other downfalls of this tablet would be that it is slow and also locks up quite a bit.  I wish I never bought it because it was a waste of $119.  I had to get a more expensive one today, I should have done that in the first place.  You get what you pay for certainly applies here.

The only drawbacks is the support is only available through e-mail.The support team for my old tablet was located in Ithicia,N.Y. You cant plug in a flash drive into the USB cable,the ends are the same size,and this one did'nt come with a case,so I have to buy 2 accessories,but other than that I love my new tablet.

Reviews.Title: Sketchy function
Reviews.Author: Hoybrook
Reviews.Content: I was excited to receive this as my first tablet at a great price, but you certainly get what you pay for.  The tablet's slick appearance is pretty much all it has going for it.  It failed to connect to WiFi service on almost all occasions and would routinely show good signal strength when attempting to connect and then state "out of range" even when just a few feet from source.  Downloading a a patch from google play did little to fix this.  If all you want to do is download a few games to play and then never connect again, this might be good but is is not the tablet for anyone wanting to have reliable internet access.  There is NO customer support from Dragon Touch or Tablet Express, Google has NOTHING to do with this tablet other than an pre-loaded application for their play store.  The only user manual is a small slip of paper included in the box that only tells you where the buttons are and how to turn it on.  I'm saving my money to buy a tablet from a known brand and strongly suggest you do the same.

Reviews.Title: Very poor battery life/defective charger
Reviews.Author: Alejandra Martinez
Reviews.Content: Got two of these tablets less than a month ago. They worked fine for the first couple weeks. I don't know how long it takes for the tablets to charge fully. But I have left them all night and when I unplug it turns out they didn't charge. I don't know if the problem is with the tablets or with the chargers. One of the chargers doesn't seem to work at all. So, I've been using one charger for both tablets. Sometimes they charge and sometimes they don't . They'll be plugged for hours and the battery will be at 10% or less. It's becoming very frustrating. I'm seriously thinking snout returning them. I hope it's not too late. I also have other problems with the tablets. They sometimes freeze and the touch screen sucks. It doesn't respond, I have to tap it several times and I have to do it hard. I know I shouldn't expect too much for that price but I am very disappointed with this product.

Reviews.Title: I am so upset
Reviews.Author: Rose August
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my speacial needs son for Christmas and it won't hold a charge  I took it to a computer shop and told the man what the tablet was doing.  he said wait don't tell me or take it out of the case yet.  This is a tablet made in China and on the back it says Drange Touch?  I said yes  got it online? . I said yes.  He said he has alot of people trying to get them fixed.  They r not holding a charge and they bought them as gifts for Christmas.  well the sad news is they can not be fixed. because as soon as they take the back off and lift the glass they break.  they do not sell parts for it so it can't be replaced.  My son is 17 years old he is speacial needs and lives in a readentcial home.  He is so upset that it can't be fixed.  I would never have bought this tablet if someone said it's not a good buy and told me why.  How do u tell a child with the needs that he has sorry I bougt this so it would break 2 mounths after. I got it for u please help us resolve this problem.  I was willing to have it fixed,  but it can't be fixed.  I would it  replaced with another one,  but not this brand I also paid shipping cost i would hope that if I get a refound for it, or a replacement that I would get a refound on the shipping cost too.  Please try to resolve this as soon as posible. He is calling me 3-4 times a day asking if I heard from u yet. It keeps him buzy.  He really enjoys  it.  The sad part is I don'd have the money to buy him another one cause if I did i would have replaced it myself.  Thank You  So upset

Reviews.Title: Gave it a try, but I am now returning it!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet through my employer's incentive program so I was really trying to give this a try. I put up with some of the "small" issues because hey, I didn't pay for it! I wanted a tablet so that I could rent e-books for school. The e-reader capabilities of the tablet are great. But if you want it to do more complex things, such as playing Candy Crush, it starts to have problems. It has forced start many applications, even when I only have one application open. I downloaded a task killer that kills apps running int he background every 15 minutes, but it seems to not kill the apps (even though I have the same app on my phone and it does it just fine). A friend of mine and I try to video chat over google hangouts (AKA Gchat) and there is a horrible feedback that sounds like birds and a huge lag time between answering the call and actually starting a conversation. I always try to blame it on her tablet, but the truth is, it is probably mine. Overall it is very lightweight, so that is a plus. But the capacative touch seems a little laggy as well. I will try to search for something and the screen will show that I touched a letter approximately 10 seconds later. I really tried to give this product a chance, but I am going to have to return it and try to find a better tablet around the same price. Not like it's much money out of my pocket as I purchased these with Amazon gift cards, but a little disappointing that I am going to have to wait before I can get one that works for my needs.
